title: SALE PENDING: 1887 N172 Old Judge - McTamany Outdoor Pose
author: h2oya311

posts.post_title: SALE PENDING: 1887 N172 Old Judge - McTamany Outdoor Pose
posts.post_content:
Up for sale are the following two N172 Old Judges.

Thomas Burns - "0439" City Background - $SOLD
Jim McTamany - "0509" Outdoor Pose - [S]$195[/S] $SALE PENDING

Paypal f/f preferred but am okay with other payment options.  The first to email me at [url]h2oya311@yahoo.com[/url] with an "I'll take it/'em" will be the new owner.

[IMG]http://photos.imageevent.com/derekgranger/derekgrangerfirstalbum/websize/1887%20Burns.jpg[/IMG][IMG]http://photos.imageevent.com/derekgranger/derekgrangerfirstalbum/websize/1887%20Burns%20_back_.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://photos.imageevent.com/derekgranger/derekgrangerfirstalbum/websize/1887%20McTamany.jpg[/IMG][IMG]http://photos.imageevent.com/derekgranger/derekgrangerfirstalbum/websize/1887%20McTamany%20_back_.jpg[/IMG]
What exactly does rebacked mean in this case? Is the back a repro and the front is original? or something else?

[quote name="Bruinsfan94" post=1621550]What exactly does rebacked mean in this case? Is the back a repro and the front is original? or something else?[/QUOTE]

The first thing you said. An Old Judge consists of a thin albumen photograph glued to a piece of cardboard. Sometimes, the photograph gets separated from the original cardboard, in which case the thin photograph is referred to as a "skinned" OJ. If somebody glues that thin phototo a modern piece of cardboard, that's a "rebaked" OJ.

Hi David -

I concur with most of what you said.  Many OJs, however are actually rebacked with the cardboard backing of less desireable OJs or other 19th Century cards.

I purchased this card as is so do not know whether the backing is vintage or more modern.  If I recall, the backing has to be relatively similar to the originals to even get a grade from SGC.
bump for price reduction on McTamany
Got the burns last week, great looking card. Very easy transaction.
